author: 0xmerp
content:
Is there any really barebones library that'll handle just the networking side of both the execution and consensus layers? 

Like, something that'll let me pass in a hex-encoded SSZ for CL or hex-encoded RLP for EL, and have it send onto the network for me and give me a true/false.

author: 0xmerp
content: I couldnt tell if the whole p2p handshake setup was necessary if I just wanted to publish 1 message and disconnect?

author: nishant0
content: could you clarify your usecase ? Sending random messages to other peers doesn't work very well, and isn't the function of the p2p network

author: 0xmerp
content: i have some scripts that generate raw transactions in RLP format and signedvalidatorexit messages in JSON or SSZ format, and i am curious if it is possible to publish these directly using the p2p port of a random public node. not sure yet if i'm actually going to use it, but it seems like it should be possible and then it's not reliant on infura or a local json-rpc node being online

author: 0xmerp
content: also because i'd like to publish using Tor, but setting up a full node to connect via Tor probably will have issues syncing, so having such a light client would be useful for that

author: nishant0
content: You will need to perform a status handshake, along with the ability to discover these new nodes to broadcast all this data to. Even then, if you don't participate in gossip or respond to other p2p rpc req/resp methods other peers might just disconnect with you. Possibly you could modify a network crawler to do what you want, but there isn't a guarantee that peering will be stable enough that you could reliably carry this out

author: 0xmerp
content: i don't have to *subscribe* to gossip to publish a gossip message, right?

author: nishant0
content:
for the consensus layer, there is this one that you can modify:
https://github.com/migalabs/armiarma

author: nishant0
content: no, you don't. You just need to have peers which are subscribed to it

author: 0xmerp
content: so the minimum it would have to do is the Libp2p noise handshake, a `/eth2/beacon_chain/req/status/1/` message encoded as SSZ then the gossipsub publish message encoded as protobuf,
